Interface Piece

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook

    public interface Piece
    An interface for all the pieces: Pawn, Bishop, Knight, Queen, King, Rook
    Version:
    May 25, 2020
    Author:
    Shreyas Kaasyap, Period: 1, Assignment: ChessBot, Sources: Shreyas Kaasyap, Sidharth Kannan, Leo Yang

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(Piece other)
      Compares two pieces, returns true if they are equal, false otherwise
      java.util.ArrayList<Board> findMoves(Board b, int index)
      Finds all possible resulting boards after moving this piece, includes illegal moves
      boolean getColor()
      returns the color of the piece, true = white, false = black
      Location getLoc()
      returns the location of the piece, 0-indexed
      int getValue()
      Returns the material value of the piece, positive for a white piece, negative for a black piece
      boolean isInCheck(Board b, int index)
      This method returns true if the piece is giving check to the opposite colored king

    • Method Detail

      • findMoves

        java.util.ArrayList<Board> findMoves(Board b,
                                     int index)
        Finds all possible resulting boards after moving this piece, includes illegal moves
        Parameters:
        b - the current chessBoard
        index - the index of that piece in the ArrayList of the current Board
        Returns:
        ArrayList the ArrayList of possible Boards

      • isInCheck

        boolean isInCheck(Board b,
                  int index)
        This method returns true if the piece is giving check to the opposite colored king
        Parameters:
        b - the current board
        index - the index of that piece in the ArrayList of the current Board
        Returns:
        boolean if the piece is giving check or not

      • getLoc

        Location getLoc()
        returns the location of the piece, 0-indexed
        Returns:
        Location

      • getColor

        boolean getColor()
        returns the color of the piece, true = white, false = black
        Returns:
        boolean

      • getValue

        int getValue()
        Returns the material value of the piece, positive for a white piece, negative for a black piece
        Returns:
        int

      • equals

        boolean equals(Piece other)
        Compares two pieces, returns true if they are equal, false otherwise
        Parameters:
        other - the piece to compare with
        Returns:
        boolean
